text: The Château de Puybardeau is a château or country house in Lignerolles, a small town and commune in the Indre département of France. It was built in the 19th century by the de Maussabré family. It was used by the French Resistance during World War II. page 2/4 Les Collègiens de La Châtre . == Notes and references == ==See also== * Heugnes Category:Houses completed in the 19th century Category:Châteaux in Indre Category:French Resistance
title: Château de Puybardeau
